column3: swimming in the iciest waters. They have the same statistics as merfolk
column4: except they have cold resistance 5 and a +2 natural armor bonus. Arctic merfolk tend to be paler than their temperate and tropical kin. Their skin tones are waxen brown
column7: and their tails can be gray blue
column13: 'CR 3): Deep merfolk live near the ocean floor in the cold and lightless depths. While they have humanoid torsos and fish tails akin to other merfolk
column14: their skin is murky and translucent
column17: silvery tails have red fins. Their eerie appearance leads to rumors that deep merfolk are evil creatures and that they worship demons and slaughter innocents. These rumors are unfounded
column18: though; deep merfolk have the same reserved nature as their kin and generally keep to themselves. While individual deep merfolk may lead evil lives

column2: 'CR listed for each variant simply lists the minimum CR required before the vrock can gain the variant in question. Other variants not listed here could also exist.'
column3: 'CR 11): These spores quickly slither along the victim’s body
column4: seeking out eyes and ears and lips in an attempt to grow over these parts of the body. Each round for 10 rounds
column5: the victim must make a Fortitude save (same DC as the vrock’s dance of ruin ability) or lose the ability to speak
